summary: Mel Waxman was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April to December 1978. The documents list his name, social security number, annual salary, and gross pay during the specified periods. The consistent appearance of his name across multiple payroll certifications indicates his continued employment with the HSCA during that time.
significance: Mel Waxman's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, contributing to the investigation of President Kennedy's assassination. The documents suggest he was a staff member involved in the committee's operations, as evidenced by his inclusion in payroll and certification reports.
